title: League client freezes when logging in.
body: When I am logging in to league of legends it ends up freezing when logging in but everything in my background is running just the programs are freezing. It freezes for like 30 seconds then it goes back to normal. Is there way to fix this I have already put my lol client's capability to run window 7 but it didn't work. This has never happened before after patch 5. something I don't remember but it has been happening for a while. Help me please this is really annoying I want to get it fixed.

replies.body:
>everything in my background is running just the programs are freezing

Do you mean A.) all applications you have running alongside League freeze when League does or B.) any application that isn't League when League freezes does not freeze?

>It freezes for like 30 seconds then it goes back to normal.

If it's not causing your other applications to freeze, could you get a screenshot of this exact moment and upload it as an attachment? I'd like to see what it's "freezing" on.

>I have already put my lol client's capability to run window 7 but it didn't work.

If you're trying that, also try setting the program to start with administrator privileges by default as well.

When I mean freeze I mean that I can't click on anything. Lets say I am watching a video and I am logging into lol everything will freeze but I will still hear the audio of the video but can't click on anything. To trigger this I need to restart and open up the client again then it will freeze. I will now set my lol client to run as administrator as default now and see how it goes I will let you know after. Thanks.
Not even the start menu? Have you tried changing your desktop resolution to something else? The standard resolutions are 1920x1080, 1280x720 and 800x600. Definitely try those out.

But this has never happened to me before it only started happening like five patches ago. Why would I need to change the resolution and if I do what would it do? Oh btw I did change the settings for lol to run at administrator as default and it still freezes.

>But this has never happened to me before it only started happening like five patches ago.

Well, maybe the patch is causing League to freeze on your computer. It's not like you can reverse the patch or anything, though. If you want to play League again then you'll have to find out why it's freezing on your computer and remedy it yourself. If it's an extremely technical reason, then you should probably [submit a support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).

In the meantime, could you take a look over [this page](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes)? Basically, make sure everything is updated, and that your computer is maintained. If using a disk drive, defrag it. Scan your computer for malicious softwares or just plain viruses. Close any other applications while you run League, mainly your firewall/anti-virus.

What changing the resolution does is... complicated. You see, League is a very old game in terms of software development. There's code in there that was created decades ago (of course, not in League, but League uses it anyway). And a long time ago, a program would not run if you had a certain screen resolution. Although Riot have tried their best to reduce the occurrence of this bug, sometimes it just manages to get through. The point of testing it at different resolutions is to make sure it's not this old bug occurring. You can always switch back to your normal resolution afterward.

You still haven't explained the exact point where League freezes. Is it always at the same point, or does it change?

Also, what graphics card do you have?
